intro: Verbascum propontideum, commonly known as the Propontis mullein, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It is a member of the Scrophulariaceae family and is characterized by its tall, erect stems and fuzzy, velvety leaves. The plant produces showy, yellowish-orange flowers that bloom in late summer. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, making it a hardy perennial in suitable climates. Its fibrous roots and robust growth make it an adaptable species for various ecological conditions.
